texts.en: Alfreda is from Sta Cruz, Tangub City. She is 44 years old. Alfreda is married and has 3 child. To make a living, Alfreda owns and operates a banana production business for their living. Alfreda has been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Alfreda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Alfreda is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to buy farm chemicals. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm chemicals

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is from the village of Rang-ay. She is 49 years old. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nora sells different kinds of fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 300 PHP a day for these activities.

At this time, Nora wants to avail PHP 10,000 to purchase different kinds of fish such as, tilapia, bighead and milk fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fish such as, tilapia, bighead and milk fish to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Buying and selling fish is the primary source of income. Gloria is 38 years old, and is married. She lives with her family in the village of Rang-ay. At this time, Gloria is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy different kinds of fish such as milk fish and "tilapia" to sell in their village. This business helps Gloria, because it's the only source of income she has to raise her family.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of fish such as milk fish and "tilapia" to sell in their village

loans.name: Sokhearn

texts.en: Sokhearn, 50, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is truck driver who approximately earns USD 4 per day. Her two children are employed in rubber plantation. They earn about USD 10 per day. Due the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Sokhearn is requesting for a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business to generate more income to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is from the town of Cabatuan. She is 36 years old, married has three children. To make a living, she has been involved in buying and selling business for over ten years and earns approximately PHP 300 daily.

According to Theresa, through the income generated from her business she had been able to give daily allowances to her children in school. Now, she wants to avail a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase different kinds of fish such as, tilapia and milk fish. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fish such as, tilapia and milk fish

loans.name: Kanda

texts.en: Kanda, 29, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been breeding pigs to sell for over six years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband runs the business of buying junk materials to resale at the junk shop. Approximately, he earns USD 4 per day. In order to improve her family’s economy, Kanda is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase farmland for growing agricultural crops. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to breed more pigs and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for growing agricultural crops

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim, 34, is married, resides with her husband and five children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a sanitation worker who earns about USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker. He earns about USD 3 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Kim is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase rice to resale for a profitable price. By doing so, she would earn extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house to provide convenient living condition for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resale for a profitable price

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Som, 44, is married, resides with her husband and seven children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been breeding pigs for over ten years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband is involved in growing rice and renting sound equipment for over three years earning approximately USD 5 per day. Two of her children are employed; one is a driver and another one is a teacher. Approximately, they earn USD 6 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Som is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a pig farm and help her children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she plans to build a new house to provide better living condition for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Yun, 30, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is employed in a sanitation company and earns approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband is a security guard and earns about USD 3 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Yun is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to run a new business of selling clothes in the market and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she plans to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Voeurn

texts.en: Voeurn, 55, is married, resides with her husband and six children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries and firewood for over three years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a marriage broker who earns approximately USD 2 per day. Three of her children are employed; two are construction worker and another one is a creel maker. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Voeurn is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would able her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future she would like to expand her grocery store and help her children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger to provide enough space for her family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Kha

texts.en: Kha, 34, is married, resides with his wife and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He has been running the business of buying cattle to resale for over seven years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. His wife runs a souvenir and clothes shop. Approximately, she earns USD 7 per day. In order to improve his wife’s business, Kha is requesting for a loan of USD 1500 to purchase more fashionable clothes to sell. This loan would enable his wife to have more fashionable clothes to attract more customers and earn more profit. In the future, he would like to use the further profit to expand the business and help his children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, he hopes to rebuild his present house to make it comfortable for his family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase more fashionable clothes to sell

loans.name: Salmun

texts.en:
Salmun, a 59 year old man is married to Yohana, a 58 year old lady. They have 8 children, between 22 to 33 years old.

Even though Salmun has a job as a teacher but Salmun also spend his spare time to run a kiosk business in order to generate more income for his family. The business is located about 10 km from his residence. 

Salmun provides corn, tamarind seed, rice, instant noodle, vegetables etc at his kiosk. Salmun is happy for this business enables him to finance his 4 children who are still at the university. Salmun would like to complete his kiosk with more stocks. Therefore he is seeking a loan of IDR 5,000,000 to purchase rice, corn and tamarind seeds etc.

loans.use: to purchase rice, corn and tamarind seeds etc.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Thy, 31, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been employed as sanitation worker for over eight years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Thy wants to rebuild her present house. With this goal in mind, Thy is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase timbers for constructing her house. This loan would enable her get a comfortable house for her family’s living. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase timbers for constructing her house

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey, 40, is married, resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a truck driver who approximately earns USD 15 per day. In order to improve her family’s economy, Srey would like to run a new business. Therefore, Srey is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase groceries to sell in order to generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she plans to repair some parts of her house.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell in order to generate extra income to support the family

loans.name: Nary

texts.en: Nary, 38, is married, resides with her husband, three children and a sister in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling sticky rice cake for over ten years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 4 per day. Her sister is a clothes seller who earns about USD 8 per day. In order to improve her family’s living condition, Nary is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more clothes to sell. This loan would enable her to get more fashionable clothes to sell and attract more clients. In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she plans to build a new wooden house.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Yon, 52, is widowed and resides with two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a chef in a restaurant. Approximately, she earns USD 5 per day. One of her children is employed in a hotel and earns about USD 3 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Yon is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her son to run the public transportation service (motor taxi). This purchase would enable her son to generate extra income to support her family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and to provide better living condition for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son to run the public transportation service (motor taxi)

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Noel is 29 years old and is married to Nova. The couple is thankful, because they been blessed with two children. Noel is involved in buying and selling fish in the local community. He wants to buy more different kinds of fish to sell, but he lacks the necessary capital. In this regard, Noel is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy "tilapia" and milk fish to sell. He believes that the loan will help his to increase his income. He is hoping that he earn a higher income to support his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy "tilapia" and milk fish to sell

loans.name: Hing

texts.en: Hing, 27, is married, resides with his wife and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He has been working as construction foreman for over three years, earning approximately USD 10 per day. His wife is employed in a massage shop and earns about USD 3 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Hing is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable him to use the saved money on his transportation expenses to the family. In the future, he would like to expand business and help his children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, he plans to rebuild his present house to make it convenient for his family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en: Hoeurn, 29, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been employed as sanitation worker for over nine years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Hoeurn is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to breed pigs to generate more income to support the family and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is hard working and loving father to seven children. He is 46 years old and married.By this time, his priority in life is to give his children the opportunity to finish their studies and achieve their goals in life. His family source of income comes from his corn field and retail store business.He is grateful because he is able to run and operate his two business despite the difficulties and pain he had experienced.

Jimmy is simple man who aims to educate all his children and improve their way of living.Since, he had started borrowing additional capital from ASKI,he is able to obtain greater income which solely serve to his family.He repaid his previous loan and ask for bigger capital amounting to P10,000.This loan amount will be use to buy more fish,meat,vegetables and ingredients to restock his retail stall.He believes that his goals will be realize and this would be his ladder in obtaining success in life and business.

loans.use: to buy more meat,fish,vegetables and ingredients for his retail stall

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is from the village of Rang-ay. She is 39 years old. Marivic sells fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately PHP 250 a day for these activities.

Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 which will be used to purchase different kinds of fish such as, milk fish and tilapia to resell. She hopes that her business will further grow and to uplift her family from poor living.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fish such as, milk fish and tilapia to resell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, aged 37 is a hog raiser in the village of Libag Sur. She is married to a construction worker and they had three children attending to school. Together, they worked untiringly to generate income for children's education and sustenance. She would like to improve her small business so she is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy feeds and vaccines for the hogs. This will help hogs grow healthier.

In the future, Teresita would like to make her busines grow for the overall betterment of the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vaccines for the hogs

loans.name: Crislyn

texts.en:
Raising pigs to fatten for future sale is the business of Crislyn. She is from the village of Libag Sur and is married to John. Crislyn is now 21 years old and had two young children. One is attending to primary school. 

Crislyn would like to ensure good growth of her hogs so that she will offer them at higher cost upon distribution. This will help increase the income acquired from the small business. So she is now asking for a loan of P11,000 to buy medicines, feeds and vaccines for the hogs. 

With good profits from the business, she will continuously provide a good education to her children and will lead them to a progressive way of life someday.

loans.use: to buy medicines, feeds and vaccines for the hogs.

loans.name: Cora

texts.en:
Cora is a helpful mother and a wife to Jose. Despite her disability, she still helped her husband generate an icome for the family. She manages a small store just in front of their house. She had been in the business for four years and earns about P200 daily. Her income really help shoulder other bills at home. She would like to sell more products to earn more income so she is asking for additional capital of P7,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, sugar, detergent soap and shampoo to sell in her store. 

Someday, she hopes to make her family live progressively and gave the best education for her only child.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, sugar, detergent soap and shampoo to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en: Rodolfo is 27 years old, happily married to Maria. They lived at the village of Libag Sur with their child. To generate an icome, Rodolfo raises hogs to fatten and sell. He also works part time in a construction site. Rodolfo earns about P3,000 each month in a construction and P2,500 whenever he sells the raise hog. He is now asking for a loan of P9,000 to buy additional piglet to raise and its feed for sustainability. He would be very thankful if this loan will be granted to him and promises to pay back on time. In the future, he hopes to achieve a stable source of income for the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglet to raise and its feed for sustainability

loans.name: Janice

texts.en: Janice is 32 years old, married and had one child. She sells dried fish to the people in her village. She offered her products on a house-to-house basis. She patiently been doing this for over four years now. She is asking for a loan of P7,000 to increase sales capacity from the business. She will buy additional dried fish to sell. In the future, Janice would like to established a stall to stock up her products. She is also praying for family's good health and good relationship to her customers. This way, she will generate continuous income from the small business.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en: Carlito is a tricycle operator for over 10 years now. He is patiently doing this to earn an income for the sustenance of his family. He is 41 years old, married and had two children. Carlito usually earns about P250 a day providing the motorcycle service. Income from the business goes for meals and allowances of his children. He is now asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy crude oil and side mirrors for the motorcycle. Carlito would like to keep ensuring safety travel for his passengers and will also generate good profit from the business.

loans.use: to buy crude oil and side mirrors for the motorcycle

loans.name: Nemerlyn

texts.en: Nemerlyn is a rice retailer in the village where they live with her spouse and two children. She is now 28 years old. She started to sell rice three years ago. Nemerlyn usually earns about P2,000 each sack of rice she sells. She is now asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy two sacks of rice to sell. Additional revenue generated from the business will be save for school expenses of her children. She wanted to gave the best education for them. She hopes someday, her children will earn a degree and seek for a good employment.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Tressa

texts.en:
Tressa, a 31 year old lady is married to Ivan, a 31 years old man. They got married one year ago. Tressa owns a beauty salon business. Prior to running the business Tressa had an accessories business. Currently she runs both businesses at the same place. Tressa employs 2 assistances to serve the customer. 
Tressa and husband built a house for them to live as well as to run the business place. She has spent their money to build the house, and now she would like to restock her beauty salon products. Therefore, she is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 to purchase hair dryer, hair steamer, chair, mirror, and other beauty salon equipments.

loans.use: to purchase hair dryer, hair steamer, chair, mirror, and other beauty salon equipments.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia sells fish in the town of Cabatuan. She is 48 years old, and is married. She has been blessed with three children. Her business serves as a source of income, she earns about PHP300 a day for these activities. Right now, she is requesting a loan of P10,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy fish such as, "tilapia" and milk fish to sell. She aims to expand her business to secure her family future.

loans.use: to buy fish such as, "tilapia" and milk fish to sell

loans.name: Sey

texts.en: Si, 58, is married, resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing maize and other agricultural crops for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who approximately earns USD 3 per day. One of her children is a construction worker as well. He earns about USD 4 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Si is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 45 -year-old married man, he is a father with three sons and one daughter.

For the past two years, Mohammad has been making and selling different types of sweets, which has been a profitable project, but also not much enough to cover the costs.

Mohammad is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing necessary missing  ingredients that is basic to make sweets such as: milk, butter, flour, sugar, egg. Taking this loan will allow Mohammad to continue his work and compete with others well and offer the requested amount from sweets that customers often request. This will increase sales and improve Mohammad's income.
Mohammad is photographed in his store while he is selling sweets to customers.

loans.use: To purchase necessary ingredients for making sweets

loans.name: Yafet

texts.en:
Yafet is a 49 year old man who is married to Rosalina, a 37 year old lady. From the marriage, they are blessed with 9 children. Two of them are working and others are still attending school. As a father of 9 children, Yafet has to work hard to cover his family needs and his children schooling fees. 

Every day Yafet struggles in meeting the household needs by selling balloons using a cart. Yafet has been running the business for years. He enjoys running this business. Every day Yafet walks with the cart from one place to another to sell balloons and toys. Yafet also buys used bottle from people and resell them to the supplier. 

Yafet plans to add more balloons, toys and to buy used bottles but he needs more capital to do so. Therefore Yafet submitted a loan application and requested a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: to purchase more balloons, toys and to buy used bottles

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is a 38-year-old retailer for Yerevan. He rents a little shop, where he trades with food. Ashot has participated in Artsakh war in the middle of 90s, during which he injured his leg, which was amputated. 
After the war Ashot decided to start his business to provide stable source of income for his family: wife and two children. Ashot's wife helps him with the business. 
Ashot has applied for this loan to add some new inventory in his shop and increase the sales. With the loan's help he plans to purchase food. This will help Ashot to increase his working capital and develop his business further.

loans.use: to pay for food

loans.name: Chhang

texts.en: Chhang, 51, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle for over six years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband runs public transportation service (Tuk Tuk). Approximately, he earns USD 5 per day. One of her children is a chef and earns about USD 3 per day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s living without electricity, Chhang is requesting a loan of USD to pay for the electricity connection. In the future, she would like to build houses for rental and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to pay for the electricity connection

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en: Rorn, is married, resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been running grocery store for over two years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about USD 3 per day. Two of her children are employed in a hotel. Approximately, they earn USD 4 per day. In order to improve her husband business, Rorn is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a walking tractor to till farmland. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a walking tractor to till farmland

loans.name: Lyan

texts.en: Lyan is a 29-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and has two siblings. In order to satisfy his family needs, Lyan’s father works nonstop. As for Lyan, he started his career as a musician since 2004. He plays music with high professionalism. Today, he wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva Partners Ameen s.a.l to purchase a sound mixer for his business. This will improve his show and allow him attract new customers as he works on a free-lance basis. In the future, he plans to open his own musical equipment shop.

loans.use: to purchase a sound mixer for his business

loans.name: Akor

texts.en:
Akor lives in Bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 28 year old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Akor heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 in order to purchase beans, sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of the children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar for sale.

loans.name: Nabeel

texts.en:
Nabeel is a 30 -year-old young married man, he is a father of two sons and one daughter, he is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all his family needs and costs.

For the past two years, Nabeel has also been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project.

Nabeel is requesting a 1,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the expenses of licensing and insuring his taxi. This will allow Nabeel to move from one place to another freely, since his taxi will become legal, this will enable Nabeel to work extra hours and increase the family's income.
Nabeel is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To pay for licensing and insuring his taxi

loans.name: Elie

texts.en: Elie is a 29-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and only one working sibling. His father is the one responsible for covering all their needs, even though they are all cooperating together in order to live a better life. Despite his young age, Elie was capable to start his own work as a farmer in 2004, with many years of experience in this domain. Today, he’s in need for a youth loan from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase fertilizers, seeds and new agricultural supplies. This loan will improve his productivity therefore his revenues thus his way of living. In the future, he plans to buy lands and increase his cultivations.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and new agricultural supplies

loans.name: Samia

texts.en: Samia is a 48-year-old widowed woman living with her three children. Two of them are still attending school while the other one is working. She works really hard to be able to satisfy her family needs and demands. She has opened her own grocery store in 2007 in her town and has gained a fair number of customers so far. Today she’s requesting to borrow a loan from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more groceries and food provisions for her shop in order to increase her sales thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own minimarket.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries and food provisions for her shop

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani is a 47 year old lady, who is married to Hendrik, a 66 year old fishmonger.  Ani and Hendrik are living with Feni - a daughter of Hendrik from his late wife. 
Ani sells “Nasi Kuning” kind of rice cooked with coconut milk and turmeric with side dishes inside such as tofu, soybean and fried chicken with herbs. She operates the business at the market nearby her residence. She has been involved in the business since 2001. 
Ani is grateful for she has customers who come every morning to buy her products that always been sold out.  She plans to enlarge her business, but she doesn’t have money to do so. Therefore, she submitted a loan application to TLM and requested a loan of IDR 4,500,000. She would like to purchase more rice, eggs, etc for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, eggs, etc for her business.

loans.name: Mehyi El Din

texts.en: Mehyi El Din is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three children who are all studying. Although his wife is working, still he is considered the main source of income in the family. She’s a hair dresser and has been six years. As for Mehyi El Din , he decided to have his own business in 2005, so he opened a barber shop. Today, he has the intention to borrow a loan from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renovate his salon and buy a new generator. This kiva loan will allow him attract added customers and therefore increase his revenues. In the future, he plans to take more kiva loans and better develop his business.

loans.use: to renovate his salon and buy a new generator

loans.name: Bol

texts.en:
Bol lives in Bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has five children; two of them are still in school. 

Bol heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 in order to purchase beans, sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of the children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar for sale.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, has a picture next to the Rickshaw he will purchase.

Ahlam is a 27 -year-old young married woman, she is a mother of two sons and one daughter,  her husband is employed with a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's costs and needs.

Ahlam is requesting a USD youth loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing a Rickshaw. This will offer to Ahlam's husband another work that will help in improving the family's income. 

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loans that are customized for Muslim borrowers. A key principle of Islam is the prohibition of charging interest on a loan. This prohibition is based on the belief that money is only a medium of exchange and has no value in itself. In order to offer loans in a manner that is considerable with borrowers' values, FATEN charges 0% interest on this loan. However, FATEN does charge a servicing fee to cover its costs. The loan amount you see listed on Kiva includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you according to this loan’s repayment schedule. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please click here.

loans.use: To complete purchasing a Rickshaw

loans.name: Awut

texts.en:
Awut lives in Bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for two years. She is 35 year old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Awut heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 in order to purchase beans, sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of the children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar for sale.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is 43 years of age, married and blessed with three children. Her primarily source of income came from sari-sari store business which is selling of variety of goods in their village. She is selling breads, beverage, soaps, shampoo, and spices. 
Nila’s husband is a farmer, planting rice in their field. Through her income from her sari-sari store, Nila provides their daily foods and other household expenses. Her husband profit from farming went for the education of their children.
Nila wants to extend the products she sells to her costumers in their village. She wishes to gain higher income to provide her children allowances in school. Nila is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy coffee, sugar, milk and can goods to sell. She hopes to avail the loan and create good services to her costumers.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, milk and can goods to sell.

loans.name: Marivil

texts.en:
Marivil doesn't only want to rely on her husband income because their household expenditures has increased and their three children is currently studying.In this situation, Marivil decided to have other source of income which is raising hogs. She currently raised, five fattening and four piglets. 

Marivil is 38 years old and married. She would like that her children could finish their studies to be able for them to find a better opportunities for their future. To work out, the planned of Marivil and her husband.She ask for financial assistance amount of P10,000 which will be use in buying livestock feeds and vaccines to improve the growth of her raised hogs even though, they haven't yet reach their optimum growth. In this sense, she could deal her hogs in higher price which enable her to improve their way of living and save some for her security purposes.

loans.use: to be use in buying livestock feeds and vaccines to improve the growth of her raised hogs

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Im, 42, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a home maker. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 8 per day. One of her children is employed in garment factory and earns approximately USD 3 per day. In order to improve her husband’s business, Im is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase construction equipment for her husband to use in his business. This purchase would enable her husband to have enough equipment to use in his construction work. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it stronger and to provide better living condition for the family, and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase construction equipment for her husband to in his business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
To make a living, Evelyn runs her homed-base store.She has been in line with this business for three years.Evelyn is married and have only one child.

Evelyn and her husband aims to improved their sources to gain bigger income for the preparation of her child's education and to satisfy their daily needs.She paid back her previous loan and ask for another loan, amount of P7,000 allowing her to buy stock merchandise for her retail store. She is indeed thankful, because of the financial support given by the ASKI to maintain and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her retail store

loans.name: Aduk

texts.en:
Aduk lives in Bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for one years. She is 28 year old, married, and has three children; all of them are still in school. 

Aduk heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 in order to purchase beans, sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of the children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar for sale.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 22 -year-old young single man, for the past three years, Yousef has been opening a barber shop, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to him.

Yousef wants to improve the quality of his work by purchasing new barber kit, so he is requesting a USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs. Taking this loan will improve the quality of Yousef's work and attract new customers to the barber shop, which will lead to increase Yousef's income.
Yousef is photographed in his barber shop while he is cutting hair one of his customers.

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loans that are customized for Muslim borrowers. A key principle of Islam is the prohibition of charging interest on a loan. This prohibition is based on the belief that money is only a medium of exchange and has no value in itself. In order to offer loans in a manner that is consistent with borrowers' values, FATEN charges 0% interest on this loan. However, FATEN does charge a servicing fee to cover its costs. The loan amount you see listed on Kiva includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you according to this loan’s repayment schedule. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase new barber kit

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en:
Sieng is 34 years old and is a married woman who has been living in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham. She is a responsible mother of 2 school-age children. Rice is the main source of the family’s income. Sieng has been a farmer for more than 22 years. Also, she raises piglets at home for extra income.

As of now, Sieng would like to take out a loan from HKL to purchase timbers to fix her house. It’s old and she wants it to become stronger. She is very happy for the given loan to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to fix her house.

loans.name: Wazo Tegeta Group

texts.en:
Evarist, who is in his early 30s is married with one son who goes to school. He has been owning a Retail Shop for three years now. He works from 7.00amto 10.00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase on the missing items, household expenses and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to increase on the retail shop inventory.  His dream is to one day be able to expand his business.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Wazo Tegeta" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase on the retail shop inventory.

loans.name: Met

texts.en: Met, 62, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been employed as a chef in the factory for over five years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband runs public transportation service (motor taxi) and earns about USD 3 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Met is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a trailer for her husband to run delivery service to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a motorbike repair shop for her husband and rebuild her present house to make it stronger to provide better living condition for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a trailer for her husband to run delivery service to generate more income to support the family

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Chea lives in Banteay Meanchey province. She is married with four boys whom are now construction workers. She does many kinds of work such as farming, raising pigs and also a construction worker. She has been doing these for fifteen years to make a living. She received the first loan from VisionFund in 2009.
Chea is now a group leader of a loan group with two members. After she completely repaid her third loan, she requested the another loan from VisionFund to buy piglets, fertilizers for her paddy and hire other to plough her rice paddy so that she can generate more income to make her family’s living condition better. The loans from VisionFund have helped to improve her business as well as to make more income for her family.

loans.use: Chea uses her loan to buy fertilizers, hire others to plough her paddy and buy piglets

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Anyieth

texts.en:
Anyieth lives in Bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 40 year old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Anyieth heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her fifth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2500 in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of the children.

loans.use: to purchase  fish for sale.

loans.name: Teap's Group

texts.en:
Teap, 30, is a leader of a group with two members. She is married with two boys. She lives in Banteay Meanchey province and feeds pigs and sell recycled stuffs. She has been in such business for around five years now. From these businesses, she could earn an average of 15,000 riel per day. Out of that, 6,000 riel is an expense. 
Teap, after completely paid off her first loan, is now requesting for a second loan from VisionFund. Before the first loan, her life was very difficult as she went to Thailand to work for others as a construction worker. She was then able to save up some amount of money and decided to come back to her hometown. With the loan from VisionFund, she started purchasing recycled materials for sales. The income generated was spent on family daily expense and set aside for expanding the business.
If she was granted the second loan, Teap will use it to expand her business by buying more recycled stuffs for selling, two more pigs and its feeds so that she can make more income to improve her family’s living condition and also keep her two boys in school.

loans.use: To buy recycled materials for sales

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Yi

texts.en: Yi, 47, is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. One of her children is a construction worker who earns about USD 4 per day. Yi wants to rebuild her present house. With this goal in mind, Yi is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase timbers to cover her house’s wall. By doing so, she would get a convenient living condition for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and help her youngest child get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to cover her house's wall

loans.name: Mahran

texts.en:
Mahran is a 29 -year-old young married man, he is a father of four sons and two daughters.
For the past two years, Mahran has been opening a workshop for fixing washing machines to customers, which has been a profitable project, but not that much enough to cover all the costs.

Mahran is requesting a 1,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing new repairing kit that will be used to fix washing machines, also purchasing number of washing machine's spare parts and engines. This will offer to Mahran the necessary kit and tools to continue his work, which will improve the family's income positively, especially that it is the only source of income to them.
Mahran is photographed on his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase new repairing kit, engines and spare parts to fix washing machines.

loans.name: Lau

texts.en:
Lau lives in Bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children; two of them are still in school. 

Lau heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 in order to purchase beans, sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of the children.

loans.use: to purchase beans,sugar for sale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 31-year old married man with children living in Fort Portal Uganda.He owns a tea plantation which he started five years ago through his personal savings.He faces hardships of price fluctuation and inadequate capital to purchase stock.His dream is educating his children,building a permanent home and buying land to grow crops. Peter needs this loan to buy more tea seedlings for planting.

loans.use: to buy more tea seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en: Rosina is a forty eight year old married woman living in Kasese Uganda,her personal goal is to educate her children,build a permanent home and self education.She has been dealing in construction of commercial houses,and has applied for a loan to help her finish up the construction.She faces hardships of high  transportation costs and taxes,however,she has a goal of moving his business to a more permanent location.

loans.use: to construct his commercial house.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is from Libag Sur. She is married to Felipe, a tricycle driver in their village. To add up her spouse income, Rosie sells grocery items to her neighborhood inside her house. She had been doing it for 10 years and was happy to acquire just enough income for daily meals and electric bills. She wanted to increase her income so she is asking for an additional capital of P14,000 to buy instant noodles, shampoo, canned goods, breads and eggs to sell. She would like to meet all her customers demand for affordable prices she offers. Someday, she hopes to construct a more convenient stall to stock up more grocery items and keep offering friendly services to her customers. This will also lead her in achieving financial stability someday.

loans.use: to buy instant noodles, shampoo, canned goods, breads and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 54 years old and married to Juan. They had two grown up children and live separately with them. Teresita doesn't want to rely on their remittances that is why she involved herself in selling clothes and beauty products to the people in her village. As of now, beauty products she offers are already disposed. Though she only generate minimal income from her business, she was happy to supplement her spouse income derived from motorcycle transport services. They worked hard everyday for the betterment of their living condition. Teresita is asking for a loan of P28,000 to invest in diversifying her business. She will buy more clothes and beauty products to sell such as cosmetics and perfumes. 

In the future, Teresita would like to keep growing as a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: buy more clothes and beauty products to sell such as cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Ayor

texts.en:
Ayor lives in Bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 27 year old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Ayor heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 in order to purchase sugar, milk. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of the children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk for sale.

loans.name: Juanalyn

texts.en:
Juanalyn lives at Libag Sur, with her spouse and three children. She is now 35 years old. Victoriano; her spouse operates a motorcycle transport services to the people in the village where they lived. At daytime, Juanalyn cooks food for snacks such as lumpia (spring rolls), breads and juice. This way, she acquires a minimum net profit of P200 daily. The couple works untiringly to provide sustenance for the family especially for education expenses of their children.
 
As of now, she wanted to improve sales from her business so she is asking for a loan to invest in expanding her small store. She is asking for P28,000 to buy lumpia wrapper, cooking oil, milk, sugar, canned goods, noodles, and eggs to sell. 

In the future, Juanalyn would like to have a stable source of income to achieve financial independence. She also would like to keep improving friendly services to her customers.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, canned goods, noodles, breads and eggs to sell in her store.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 58 years old, married and had three children. Aside from backyard hog raising, Pilar sells fruits and vegetables to increase her income. She is offering fruits and vegetables on a house-to-house basis. Additional revenue acquired from the business was added to her savings to use in times of emergencies.

She would like to make her business more profitable so she is now asking for an additional capital of P22,000 to buy cabbages, eggplant, tomatoes and onions to re-sell them for profits. This will help improve her income. 

In the future, Pilar would like to keep growing as an entrepreneur and gave the best education for her children.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, eggplant, tomatoes and onions and re-sell them for profits.

loans.name: Danilon Marina

texts.en:
At age 35, Danilon Marina had blessed with three children. She is married to a driver. To supplement her spouse income, she is raising hogs and re-sell them for profits. This way, she generates about P2,500 whenever she sell the raise hog. Through her determination and patience in the business, she is making it profitable. She would like to keep improving it so she is asking for a loan of P12,000 to buy additional piglet to raise, its feed and vaccines for sustainability.Ensuring hogs good growth will allow her to offer it at higher cost and gain a rewarding price for it. 

Danilon Marina also would like to continuously provide a good education for her children and secure a good future for them.

loans.use: to buy additional piglet to raise, its feed and vaccines for sustainability

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Raising hogs to sell for profits is the business of Rosalina. She is 56 years old and is married. Her spouse works as a construction worker. She was thankful for acquiring good income from the hog raising business. She usually earn about P2,000 each hog she was able to disposed. Rosalina wanted to improve her income so she is asking for additional capital of P10,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for the hogs. 

In the future, she would like to establish a small store to increase her income. This will lead her to attain economic stability.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for the hogs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a thirty eight year old married lady with five children living in Kasese Uganda,her personal goal is to educate her children,and she has been dealing in second hand clothing for the last ten years and her major hardships are:price fluctuation and inflation and inadquate capitalto purchase stock,however,she has a vision of expanding his business to new markets,she has applied for a loan to help her buy second hand clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nyabol

texts.en:
Nyabol lives in Bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Nyabol heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 in order to purchase wheat flour, sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of the children.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar for sale.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy is a 38 year old married lady who operates a bar and lodge business in Kagadi for 10 years now .She started with agriculture harvested 12 sacks of maize sold and got capital to start a bar.She faces a problem of price fluctuation which erodes most of the profits and inadequate capital. She has a dream of building a permanent home and buying a car.Teddy would like to expand her business into new markets and hire employees to help expand business. She intends to use the loan to buy beers, sodas and beds for the business.

loans.use: to buy beers, sodas, beds for the business.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 28 year old business man who deals in the sell of maize, beans and groundnuts in Kagadi town. He has 5 children and has been in this business for a period of 5 years.He started by buying 5 sacks with money got from Sacco and went on progressing .Patrick faces a problem of price fluctuation and inflation which erodes most of the profits and inadequate capital. He would like to educate his children and buy a car.Patrick would like to expand his business into new markets and also add value to the products by processing them.He therefore wants a loan to buy a milling machine.

loans.use: to buy a milling machine.

loans.name: Batkhuu

texts.en:
Batkhuu is a 43-year-old widow who lives with her son and daughter, ages 23 and 24, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a small house in the outer 'ger' district (a district without basic infrastructure). Batkhuu’s son is a web designer and her daughter works as a teacher at a local public school. 

Batkhuu supports her family by operating a retail clothing stall at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. When she first began her business in 2003, Batkhuu had 800,000 MNT in working capital. Today, her business has grown and she has about 4,000,000 MNT in working capital. Batkhuu sells jeans and trousers. “I want to grow my business more with this loan and I would like to be able to buy my own apartment in future and live there with my family,” she says. 

Batkhuu is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to increase the variety of jeans and trousers she sells.  Because it’s the beginning of high shopping season.

loans.use: to purchase jeans and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Morn

texts.en: Morn, 61, is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling Khmer noodle for over two years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her two children are employed as a dealer and factory worker. Approximately, they earn USD 6 per day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s living without water supply, Morn is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to pay for well digging in order to get the water to use. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store to generate extra income to support the family.

loans.use: to pay for well digging

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer lives in Bor. She sells food stuff, and has been in business for three years. She is 28 year old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Amer heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 in order to purchase sugar milk. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of the children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk for sale.

loans.name: Madrine

texts.en: Maldrine is a 37 year old lady who deals in a second hand cloth business which she has run for a period of 8 years.She started with agriculture and after a good sale of the harvest she ventured into clothing business. She says inadequate capital and high taxes are affecting the business.She would like to buy a car and expand her business to new markets.Maldrine wants a loan to buy bedsheets and bed covers for sale.

loans.use: to buy bedsheets and bed covers for sale.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen lives in Bor. She sells food staff, and has been in business for three years. She is 28 year old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Ayen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 in order to purchase sugar, milk. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of the children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk for sale.

loans.name: Sun Heng

texts.en: Sun Heng, 42, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband has been noodle for over six years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. In order to improve her business, Sun Heng is requesting a loan of USD 200 to purchase more equipment to use in her business. By doing so, she would produce noodle faster to sell for her clients. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide better living condition for the family, and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment to use in her business

loans.name: Security Group

texts.en:
Zubeda, who is in her mid 40s is married with five children, two of them are still at school and the three of them are group-ups. She has been running several small businesses.  She sell clothes door to door, sells local ice cream and ice cubes for six years now.  She works from 10.00 am to 12 noon (just for two hours only) and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use for increasing on clothes, local ice cream and ice cubes to resale.  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Security" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans

loans.use: to increase on clothes, local ice cream and ice cubes.

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en: Thorn is a mother of four children whom are construction workers. She is now 38 years old and lives in Mongkol Borey District. This is her third loan with VisionFund. Before the first loan, Thorn worked for others as a construction worker and saved money for renting a plot of rice paddy for farming. Thorn repaid her previous loans regularly and on time. After the second loan ended, she requested another loan from VisionFund hoping to get the money to rent a plot of rice paddy for farming and buy fertilizers. With this loan, she hopes to make more income to help her family for a better living condition. Thorn is now leading a group of two female members.

loans.use: To rent a plot of rice paddy for farming and to buy fertilizer

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Rodesa

texts.en: Rodesa is 36 years old, married and has two school-aged children. Rodesa engaged in hog-raising business that primarily involves hogs for breeding. It is a business, she started a several years ago. As of now, Rodesa wants to expand her business, this is why she is taking out this loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed, vaccine and additional hog to raise. This business helps Rodesa, because it's the only source of income she has to raise her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and additional hog to raise

loans.name: Nyandit

texts.en:
Nyandit lives in Bor. She sells food staff, and has been in business for three years. She is 28 year old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Nyandit heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 in order to purchase sugar, milk. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of the children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk for sale.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 31 -year-old young married man, he is a father of two sons and one daughter.

For the past three years, Rami has been opening a sewing workshop for sewing and selling clothes to customers, which has been a profitable project, but also not enough to cover the costs.

Rami wants to expand the size of his workshop to meet the high demand of customers requests as he has a good reputation in the market, so he is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing additional new sewing machine. This will increase number of sewing machines he has in the workshop which will help him to finish sewing clothes on time, this will lead to increase sales and improve the family's income.
Rami is photographed in his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machine

loans.name: Maly

texts.en: Maly, 50, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over six years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. All of her children are construction workers. Approximately, they earn USD 9 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Maly is requesting a loan of USD 500 to raise capital in her business in order to purchase more groceries to sell. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it stronger to provide better living condition for the family.

loans.use: to raise capital in her business in order to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Tserenpeljee

texts.en:
Mr. Tserenpiljee, 38 runs a taxi business around the Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He started his business in 2008 and earns the money which is not so enough for his family expenses. He lives with his wife and his 2 children in a rental apartment. His wife is unemployed and cares her kids at home in last few years. 
With above reason, he decided to start his second business such as a tire repair service with his younger brothers. As he thinks it is a very beneficial and important to improve his family income in the future. Last month they purchased the equipments of tire repair service. Now he needs to have a workshop for his new business. He is planning to build it in next 3 months by himself. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchase the building materials to build his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase the building materials to build his workshop.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 36 years old,married to Florencio who is a farmer. The couple has been blessed with four children.According to her, the eldest is already graduate of vocational course;two are still studying and the youngest is in infant-aged.

Currently, Marites works at magnolia company to have an extra income.Aside from the salary she received from her work, she also runs her hog raising business.She is really thankful because she is able to cover up all their daily household expenses and daily allowances of her two children.

Her greatest aim is to send her children into higher level of education and improve her financial stability. To make her plan reality,she is asking for bigger loan,in the amount of P25,000.She will be using this amount, in buying three piglets and livestock feeds.She knows that her patience and sacrifices will give her the hopes in attaining success in life.

loans.use: to buy livestock feeds and three piglets for her hog raising business

loans.name: Adut

texts.en:
Adut lives in Bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Adut heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of the children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 37 years old single mother with 4 children. She sells vegetables and other groceries at her local open air market for the last 7 years. She was introduced to KADET by one of the field officers and plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of vegetables and groceries for sale to sustain the increasing demand and also make extra profits. 

In the future, Elizabeth hopes to expand her business and get enough cash and be able to start large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy more stock of vegetables and other grocerires i.e tomatoes and kales

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca’s goal in life is to uplift her family living out of poverty. She works hard to attain her goal. Her inspiration to achieve her goal is her four children who are two of them are sending in school.
Francisca is 55 years old, and is married. She is a vendor in the market selling toys and bags. She has been in this business for 35 years. She is proud to share that through her income from the business, Francisca is able to provide her two eldest children allowances and fees in school, who are now a degree holder. Her husband is also a vendor.
Francisca wishes to pursue her two eldest children their education. She is continuing to works hard to attain her wish. She wishes that she could sell more items and gain higher income to further support her children needs in school. Francisca is requesting a loan of P50,000 to buy additional items of bags and toys to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy additional items of bags and toys to sell in the market.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 32 year old lady dealing in salon business.She has operated it for 7 years which she started with capital got from the bank as a loan and faces a problem of inadequate capital to facilitate the business and local taxes imposed. Grace would like mostly to build a permanent home and move her business to more permanent location.She wants a loan to buy cosmetics for sale.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Byambatsogt

texts.en: Mr. Byambatsogt, 42 is a taxi driver and lives with his 3 children and his wife in the slum district of the Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running his business since 2004 and it is a main income source of this family now. Because his wife is unemployed and she responds her house works and cares her kids. Lately his car has been bad and damaged to some of its parts. It influences worst his business such as decreasing the earnings. So that he decided to repair and renovate his car. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchase the spare parts and make repair his car.

loans.use: To purchase the spare parts and make repair his car.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen lives in Bor. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is 35 year old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Ayen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of the children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en: Chreb, 37, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in agricultural business for over five years, and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and breeding duck to eggs to sell. Approximately, they earn USD 8 per day. Due to lack of fund, Chreb is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase fodder for feeding ducks. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for feeding duck

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 44 year old lady with 6 children practicing agriculture as her primary business though she is a teacher by profession.She says she has practiced it for 15 years and faces a problem of inadequate capital to facilitate the activity.Jane would like mostly to educate her children and build a permanent home. She would like to diversify and start rearing chicken.Jane wants a loan to pay fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay fees for her children.

loans.name: Tsermaa

texts.en:
Tsermaa is a-55-year-old woman who lives with her daughter and spoon-fed spouse in a small apartment. Her daughter is high school pupil, and her husband became a spoon-fed a few years ago. 

Aside looking after her spouse she supports her family by operating pharmacy business at her apartment’s downstairs. She is a very hardworking and strong woman who vows all her life only for her family. 

“I have a few year experience in pharmacy business and I really appreciate that my business is expands as before when I started, and if I buy a cash machine I can save all income there not in my wallet, its more comfortable for me and my micro business” she said happily.  

Tsermaa is requesting a 1.500.000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to purchase cash machine in her pharmacy.

loans.use: to purchase a cash machine in her pharmacy.

loans.name: Sarangerel

texts.en: Mrs. Sarangerel, 48 is a water specialist and she has a small cow farm in her home. She lives with her husband in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. They have a son who recently moved out his parent house. She has been conducting her cow firm since 2005 and currently it has 15 cows totally. Her son Mashbayar, 18 studies in the high school. He really wants to assist his parent to improve their family life. Recently he purchased a turbine engine car which uses the natural gas fuel completely for running the taxi around the city beyond his lessons. He thinks it is a good way to improve his and his family financial issue. Also he believes that the using of turbine engine /natural gas engine/ car will be environmental or natural oriented idea.  But last month its engine is broken.  Therefore he needs money of MNT 3,000,000 to purchase a new turbine engine and make the some repairs for his green car`.

loans.use: To purchase a new turbine engine and make the some repairs for his green car`.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Oun is married and a mother of three children, all of whom are dependent. She is 36 years old and lives in Kompong Cham province. She received the first loan from VisionFund in 2011. Oun owns a small store selling Cambodian noodles and some grocery products. She also buys fruits from others for reselling to make additional income to support her family. Recently, she requested another loan from VisionFund to buy fruits such as mangoes for reselling. She hopes to raise more income from selling these fruits and also to send all her children to school.

loans.use: To buy fruits for reselling

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Angeth

texts.en:
Angeth lives in Bor. She sells breads, and has been in business for two years. She is 28 year old, married, and has two children; all of them are still in school. 

Angeth heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 in order to purchase breads. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of the children.

loans.use: to purchase breads for sale.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 40 years old milk vendor, married and blessed with four children. He has been a milk vendor for the past 13 years and earns a monthly income of Kes 30,000 per month. He has requested for his first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 30,000 to purchase more milk for sale. 

His hopes and dreams are to expand his business as well as build rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase more milk for sale.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en: Sokhorn, 37, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for over ten years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband runs public transportation service (motor taxi) and earns about USD 5 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Sokhorn is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a threshing machine for rental. This purchase would enable her to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it stronger in order to provide convenient living condition for the family and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a threshing machine for rental

loans.name: Byamba

texts.en:
Borrower Byamba is a-54-year-old widow who has two daughters and live with her daughters in outer ger district lacks basic infrastructure of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She supports her family by operating a clothing sale business at the second largest outdoor market of the city. 

She is requesting a 1.000.000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to purchase clothes to sell for this spring season.  She is one of trusted client of Trasncapital CoLtd.,

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Jet Group

texts.en:
Betül , born in 1978 in  İstanbul, is the mother of two. Her husband is a laborer at a factory. While she lives a very humble life, she has big dreams that she says she has come closer to reaching after meeting maya. She began working doing sales from her own house via catalogues for an undergarments and sleepwear company. after traveling from house to house and gathering a particular group of customers, she formed her own group of salespeople and started to make profit from their sales.  She then applied to maya with the group she formed from her salespeople and took a loan, thus expanding her sales by bringing in more products. as a result, Betül Hanım expanded her own business and the group members were able to better support their families.Now Betül Hanım has realized another of her dreams thanks to maya. After noticing that there was no sewing supplies store in her neighborhood she opened one of her own, not wanting to miss this opportunity. Now she will continue doing the work she does both at home and as a shop owner better from her shop.  This is their first loan through kiva.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Volunteers

Betül,  1978 İstanbul doğumlu evli 2 çocuk annesi.Eşi bir fabrikada işçi olarak çalışıyor Betül,çok mütevazi bir hayatı var fakat bunun yanında çokta güzel hayalleri .Maya ile tanıştıktan sonra bu hayallerine biraz daha yaklaştığını dile getire Betül işi ile ilgili sarfettiği aşamaları şöyle antalıyor;kendi evinden bir iç çamaşırı ve pijama firmasının ürünlerinin katalog üzerinden satışını yaparak başladı ev ev gezerek işini yapmaya çalışan Betül belli bir kesim müşterisini sağladıktan sonra birde kendi alt üyelerini oluşturdu ve onların satışından da kar yapmaya başladı.Maya’ya başvuru yaptığında ise kendi alt üyeleriyle oluşturduğu grupla kredisini çekti ve daha fazla ürün getirerek satışlarını büyüttü.Betül hem kendi işlerini ilerletti hem de grup üyelerinin böylelikle ailelerine büyük destek oldular,şimdi ise Betül bir hayalini daha Maya sayesinde gerçekleştirdi.Kendisine ait bir tuhafiye dükkanı açan Betül Hanım oturduğu semte bu tür bir iş yeri olmadığını farkedince bu fırsatı kaçırmak istemedi şimdi hem bir dükkan sahibi hemde  evden yaptığı işi dükkanınından daha iyi bir şekilde yürütücek.

loans.use: to buy more product

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Fish vending has been the first business of Leonilla,she has managed it for almost one year.According to her,she didn't continue this kind of business due to many credit that are not collected. Her situation during those times are down but since,she joined ASKI,she is able to have the eagerness in obtaining success in life.As days passed by, she had involved herself in hog raising business. In this kind of business, her income had increased that's the reason why she is able to produce her machine in sewing.Leonilla couldn't really explain what she feels that time because after the sufferings she had undergo still the sun is shining in achieving success in life. 

By this time, she runs her sewing business. At her age 64 years old, still she is able to sew different kinds of curtains,pants,pillow case,blouses and short pants.She really enjoy running the business she have because she is able to earn approximately P12,000. This is really a big blessing to her because she could cover up all her household expenses and provide livestock feeds of her raised hogs. As responsible borrower, she had maintained a good tract of record and now she is asking for bigger capital amounting to P30,000 allowing her to buy stock garments,threads and other materials needed in her sewing business. she hopes to have continues access of financial services to ASKI to be able improve her living condition and improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to be use in buying stock garments,threads and other materials needed in her sewing business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 41 and is married with six children aged between 3 and 18 years old. She sells clothes and she has been in this business for five years. 

Alice has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more clothes to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lour

texts.en: Lour, 49, is married, resides with her husband and eight children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in agricultural business for over twenty years, have an extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. Approximately, they earn USD 3 per day. Five of her children are employed in garment factory. They earn about USD 18 per day. Due to the difficulty in pumping the water into her rice field, Lour is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to purchase a pumping machine for pumping the water. This purchase would enable her to reduce the operating cost in her farming work and get higher yield. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and help her children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide convenient living condition for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a pumping machine for pumping the water

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Sreng, 30, is a resident from Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She lives with her husband and two school-age children there. She devotes herself in agricultural business, cultivating rice crops on her own farmland. Her husband is supportive to help her all the way she works in or outdoors. Besides rice husbandry, this couple is involved in another type of business is to make and sell small mill (mortar made of hard wood) for profit. 

In order to sustain the second business of the family, Sreng is taking out a loan to purchase raw stones for mill making business. This loan will improve her household income. With the generated profit, Sreng will use it to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase raw stones for mill making business.

loans.name: Joseph
